doc.name: JAIDCT
doc.description: Calculate the discrete cosine transform of an image. Even though the input image data may be 3 bytes (one for each band) per pixel, the output image data is of a higher resolution (doubles), not suitable for displaying or saving. To display or save the output of this image, use the ptolemy.actor.lib.jai.JAIDataConvert actor to cast the data to an appropriate type (for instance, byte). The output of the DCT is zero padded to the next power of 2 in each dimension (unless that dimensions is already a power of two, in which case, nothing happens).
doc.author: James Yeh
